verses.verse: It happened in those days, <WH3117> when there was no king <WH4428> in Israel, <WH3478> that there was a certain <WH376> Levite <WH3881> living <WH1481> on the farther side <WH3411> of the hill <WH2022> country of Ephraim, <WH669> who took <WH3947> to him a concubine <WH802> out of Bethlehem Judah. <WH1035>

His concubine <WH6370> played the prostitute <WH2181> against him, <WH3212> and went away from him to her father <WH1>'s house <WH1004> to Bethlehem Judah, <WH1035> and was there the space of four <WH702> months. <WH2320>

Her husband <WH376> arose, <WH6965> and went <WH3212> after <WH310> her, <WH1696> to speak kindly <WH3820> to her, <WH7725> to bring her again, having his servant <WH5288> with him, <WH6776> and a couple of donkeys: <WH2543> and she brought <WH935> him into her father <WH1>'s house; <WH1004> and when the father <WH1> of the young lady <WH5291> saw <WH7200> him, <WH8055> he rejoiced to meet him. <WH7125>

His father-in <WH2859>-law, the young lady <WH5291>'s father, <WH1> retained <WH2388> him; <WH3427> and he stayed with him three <WH7969> days: <WH3117> so they ate <WH398> and drink, <WH8354> and lodged there. <WH3885>

It happened on the fourth <WH7243> day, <WH3117> that they arose early <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> and he rose up <WH6965> to depart: <WH3212> and the young lady <WH5291>'s father <WH1> said <WH559> to his son-in <WH2860>-law, "Strengthen <WH5582> your heart <WH3820> with a morsel <WH6595> of bread, <WH3899> and afterward <WH310> you shall go your way. <WH3212>"

So they sat down, <WH3427> ate, <WH398> and drank, <WH8354> both <WH8147> of them together: <WH3162> and the young lady <WH5291>'s father <WH1> said <WH559> to the man, <WH376> "Please be pleased <WH2974> to stay all night, <WH3885> and let your heart <WH3820> be merry. <WH3190>"
The man <WH376> rose up <WH6965> to depart; <WH3212> but his father-in <WH2859>-law urged <WH6484> him, <WH3885> and he lodged there again. <WH7725>

He arose early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242> on the fifth <WH2549> day <WH3117> to depart; <WH3212> and the young lady <WH5291>'s father <WH1> said, <WH559> "Please strengthen <WH5582> your heart <WH3824> and stay <WH4102> until the day declines; <WH3117>" and they both <WH8147> ate. <WH398>

When the man <WH376> rose up <WH6965> to depart, <WH3212> he, <WH6370> and his concubine, and his servant, <WH5288> his father-in <WH2859>-law, the young lady <WH5291>'s father, <WH1> said <WH559> to him, <WH3117> "Behold, now the day draws <WH7503> toward evening, <WH6150> please stay all night: <WH3885> behold, <WH3117> the day grows to an end, <WH2583> lodge <WH3885> here, <WH3824> that your heart may be merry; <WH3190> and tomorrow <WH4279> go on your way <WH1870> early, <WH7925> that you may go <WH1980> home. <WH168>"

But the man <WH376> wouldn't <WH14> stay that night, <WH3885> but he rose up <WH6965> and departed, <WH3212> and came <WH935> over against <WH5227> Jebus <WH2982> (the same is Jerusalem <WH3389>): and there were with him a couple <WH6776> of donkeys <WH2543> saddled; <WH2280> his concubine also was with him. <WH6370>

When they were by Jebus, <WH2982> the day <WH3117> was far <WH3966> spent; <WH7286> and the servant <WH5288> said <WH559> to his master, <WH113> "Please come <WH3212> and let us turn aside <WH5493> into this city <WH5892> of the Jebusites, <WH2983> and lodge in it. <WH3885>"

His master <WH113> said <WH559> to him, <WH5493> "We won't turn aside into the city <WH5892> of a foreigner, <WH5237> that is not of the children <WH1121> of Israel; <WH3478> but we will pass over <WH5674> to Gibeah. <WH1390>"
He said <WH559> to his servant, <WH5288> "Come <WH3212> and let us draw near <WH7126> to one <WH259> of these places; <WH4725> and we will lodge <WH3885> in Gibeah, <WH1390> or in Ramah. <WH7414>"
So they passed on <WH5674> and went their way; <WH3212> and the sun <WH8121> went down <WH935> on them near <WH681> to Gibeah, <WH1390> which belongs to Benjamin. <WH1144>

They turned aside <WH5493> there, <WH935> to go in to lodge <WH3885> in Gibeah: <WH1390> and he went in, <WH935> and sat him down <WH3427> in the street <WH7339> of the city; <WH5892> for there was no man <WH376> who took <WH622> them into his house <WH1004> to lodge. <WH3885>

Behold, <WH935> there came an old <WH2205> man <WH376> from his work <WH4639> out of the field <WH7704> at evening: <WH6153> now the man was <WH376> of the hill <WH2022> country of Ephraim, <WH669> and he lived <WH1481> in Gibeah; <WH1390> but the men <WH582> of the place <WH4725> were Benjamites. <WH1145>

He lifted up <WH5375> his eyes, <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> the wayfaring <WH732> man <WH376> in the street <WH7339> of the city; <WH5892> and the old <WH2205> man <WH376> said, <WH559> "Where are you going? <WH3212> Where <WH370> did you come from? <WH935>"

He said <WH559> to him, <WH5674> "We are passing from Bethlehem Judah <WH1035> to the farther side <WH3411> of the hill <WH2022> country of Ephraim. <WH669> I am from there, <WH3212> and I went to Bethlehem Judah. <WH1035> I am going <WH1980> to the house <WH1004> of Yahweh; <WH3068> and there is no man <WH376> who takes <WH622> me into his house. <WH1004>

Yet there is <WH3426> both straw <WH8401> and provender <WH4554> for our donkeys; <WH2543> and there is bread <WH3899> and wine <WH3196> also for me, <WH519> and for your handmaid, and for the young man <WH5288> who is with your servants: <WH5650> there is no want <WH4270> of anything. <WH1697>"
The old <WH2205> man <WH376> said, <WH559> "Peace <WH7965> be to you; <WH7535> howsoever let all your wants <WH4270> lie on me; <WH3885> only don't lodge in the street. <WH7339>"
So he brought <WH935> him into his house, <WH1004> and gave the donkeys <WH2543> fodder; <WH1101> and they washed <WH7364> their feet, <WH7272> and ate <WH398> and drink. <WH8354>

As they were making their hearts <WH3820> merry, <WH3190> behold, <WH582> the men of the city, <WH5892> certain <WH582> base <WH1100> fellows, <WH582> surrounded <WH5437> the <WH5437> house, <WH1004> beating <WH1849> at the door; <WH1817> and they spoke <WH559> to the master <WH1167> of the house, <WH1004> the old <WH2205> man, <WH376> saying, <WH559> "Bring out <WH3318> the man <WH376> who came <WH935> into your house, <WH1004> that we may have sex with him! <WH3045>"

The man, <WH376> the master <WH1167> of the house, <WH1004> went out <WH3318> to them, <WH559> and said to them, <WH408> "No, my brothers, <WH251> please don't <WH7489> act so wickedly; since <WH310> this man <WH376> has come <WH935> into my house, <WH1004> don't <WH6213> do this folly. <WH5039>

Behold, <WH1330> here is my virgin daughter <WH1323> and his concubine. <WH6370> I will bring them out <WH3318> now. <WH6031> Humble them, <WH6213> and do with them what seems <WH5869> good <WH2896> to you; <WH376> but to this man don't <WH6213> do any <WH2063> such <WH1697> folly. <WH5039>"

But the men <WH582> wouldn't <WH14> listen <WH8085> to him: <WH376> so the man laid <WH2388> hold of his concubine, <WH6370> and brought <WH3318> her out <WH2351> to them; <WH3045> and they had sex with her, <WH5953> and abused her all night <WH3915> until the morning: <WH1242> and when the day <WH7837> began to dawn, <WH5927> they let her go. <WH7971>

Then came <WH935> the woman <WH802> in the dawning <WH6437> of the day, <WH1242> and fell down <WH5307> at the door <WH6607> of the man <WH376>'s house <WH1004> where her lord <WH113> was, <WH216> until it was light.

Her lord <WH113> rose up <WH6965> in the morning, <WH1242> and opened <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of the house, <WH1004> and went out <WH3318> to go <WH3212> his way; <WH1870> and behold, <WH802> the woman his concubine <WH6370> was fallen down <WH5307> at the door <WH6607> of the house, <WH1004> with her hands <WH3027> on the threshold. <WH5592>

He said <WH559> to her, <WH6965> "Get up, and let us be going! <WH3212>" but no one <WH376> answered. <WH6030> Then he <WH376> took <WH3947> her up on the donkey; <WH2543> and the man <WH376> rose up, <WH6965> and went to his place. <WH4725>

When he had come <WH935> into his house, <WH1004> he took <WH3947> a knife, <WH3979> and laid hold <WH2388> on his concubine, <WH6370> and divided <WH5408> her, <WH6106> limb by limb, into twelve <WH8147> pieces, <WH5409> and sent <WH7971> her throughout all the borders <WH1366> of Israel. <WH3478>

It was so, <WH1961> that all who saw <WH7200> it said, <WH559> "There was no such deed <WH2063> done nor seen <WH7200> from the day <WH3117> that the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> to this day! <WH3117> Consider <WH7760> it, <WH5779> take counsel, and speak. <WH1696>"
